medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 6 weeks before evaluation when the patient identified a painless lump above the left testicle. He reported mild discomfort in the right flank and upper quadrant during evaluation, along with a small bulge in that area.
medical_history.family_history: The mother had gastrointestinal stromal tumor, the father had skin melanoma and died of a stroke, and the maternal grandfather died of gastric cancer. No family history of genitourinary cancer, renal disease, or genitourinary disease.
medical_history.social_history: The patient worked as a cook. He emigrated from South America 11 years prior and lived in coastal Massachusetts. He did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit substances. He was married and had a healthy 2-year-old son.
